items.name: Apply: Network
items.description: Applies the Network subset from the integrated performance pack.

steps.command: reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip6\Parameters" /v "DisabledComponents" /t REG_DWORD /d "255" /f >nul 2>&1
reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip6\Parameters" /v DisabledComponents /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f >nul 2>&1
netsh interface teredo set state disabled >nul 2>&1
sc config NetTcpPortSharing start=disabled
sc config "Intel(R) Capability Licensing Service TCP IP Interface" start=disabled >nul 2>&1

items.name: Install Falcon Power Plans
items.description: Creates Falcon Desktop Hardcore and Falcon Laptop Performance plans (if missing).

items.name: Apply Falcon Desktop Hardcore Plan
items.description: Applies a desktop-focused max performance plan and activates it.

items.name: Apply Falcon Laptop Performance Plan
items.description: Applies a laptop-focused performance plan (AC) and activates it.

items.name: Restore Previous Power Plan
items.description: Restores the plan that was active before the last Falcon plan apply.

items.name: Apply Network Profile: Falcon
items.description: Applies Falcon network defaults (safe).

items.name: Apply Network Profile: Latency
items.description: Applies latency-focused TCP globals (more restrictive autotuning).

items.name: Apply Network Profile: Balanced
items.description: Applies balanced TCP globals.

items.name: Apply Network Profile: FPS
items.description: Applies FPS-oriented TCP globals (similar to Falcon defaults).

items.name: Network: Create/Open Custom Overrides
items.description: Opens network_overrides.json for custom values, then apply Custom.

items.name: Apply Network Profile: Custom
items.description: Applies values from network_overrides.json.

items.name: Restore Network Globals (Best-effort)
items.description: Restores common Windows defaults for TCP globals (best-effort).

items.name: Maintenance: Cleanup (Safe)
items.description: Clears temp caches (safe).

items.name: Maintenance: Cleanup (Aggressive)
items.description: Clears temp + Prefetch (may cause first-launch stutter).

items.name: Cooling: FanControl (tool)
items.description: Installs and launches FanControl (for fan curves/presets).

items.name: Disable NDU
items.description: Disables Network Data Usage Monitoring (NDU).

items.name: Classic Battery & Network Icons
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Uses classic tray icons where available.

items.name: Disable IPv6 (System-wide)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables IPv6 by setting DisabledComponents and unbinding IPv6 from all adapters. Can improve stability on some networks but will break IPv6-only connectivity.

steps.command: Disable-NetAdapterBinding -Name '*' -ComponentID ms_tcpip6 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Enable-NetAdapterBinding -Name '*' -ComponentID ms_tcpip6 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

items.name: Reduce Network Telemetry & Active Probing
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Reduces network-related telemetry: disables Wi-Fi hotspot reporting and Delivery Optimization peer-to-peer and turns off active internet probing (NCSI). May cause Windows to misreport connectivity status.

items.name: Normal Mode
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Restores throughput-focused settings.

steps.command: netsh interface tcp set global autotuninglevel=normal
netsh interface tcp set global ecncapability=disabled

items.name: Ultra Low Bufferbloat
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Latency-focused settings (reduced throughput).

steps.command: netsh interface tcp set global autotuninglevel=disabled
netsh interface tcp set global ecncapability=enabled

items.name: Bufferbloat Test
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Opens a bufferbloat test in your browser.

steps.command: start "" "https://www.waveform.com/tools/bufferbloat"

items.name: Apply: Network Priority (DSCP 46)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Creates a QoS policy that marks outbound UDP traffic with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding).

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-NetQosPolicy -Name \"Falcon UDP DSCP46\" -IPProtocol UDP -DSCPAction 46 -PolicyStore ActiveStore -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name \"Falcon UDP DSCP46\" -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Creates a QoS policy that marks outbound UDP traffic with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding).
items.name: Revert: Network Priority (DSCP 46)

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name \"Falcon UDP DSCP46\" -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.name: Remove Network Priority Policy
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Removes Falcon UDP DSCP46 policy.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name \"Falcon UDP DSCP46\" -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.name: Optimize Network Priority
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Optimizes network provider order (Local → Hosts → DNS → NetBT).

items.name: Optimize SMB & LAN Server Tweaks
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Tunes SMB settings for LAN performance.

items.name: Optimize UDP Firewall Settings
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Applies conservative UDP firewall behavior tweaks.

items.name: Remove Limits on QoS
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Sets NonBestEffortLimit to 0%.

steps.command: netsh interface tcp set heuristics enabled

items.name: Apply: Optimize MPP
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables TCP timestamps to reduce overhead.

steps.command: netsh interface tcp set global timestamps=disabled
netsh interface tcp set global timestamps=enabled

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables TCP timestamps to reduce overhead.
items.name: Revert: Optimize MPP

steps.command: netsh interface tcp set global timestamps=enabled

items.name: Apply: Disable Nagle (All Interfaces)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables Nagle algorithm for all interfaces (low latency).

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ New-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpNoDelay -PropertyType DWord -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null }
$ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpNoDelay -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables Nagle algorithm for all interfaces (low latency).
items.name: Revert: Disable Nagle (All Interfaces)

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpNoDelay -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.name: Apply: Disable Delayed ACK (All Interfaces)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Reduces ACK delay for lower latency.

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ New-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpAckFrequency -PropertyType DWord -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null; New-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TCPDelAckTicks -PropertyType DWord -Value 0 -Force | Out-Null }

$ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpAckFrequency -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TCPDelAckTicks -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Reduces ACK delay for lower latency.
items.name: Revert: Disable Delayed ACK (All Interfaces)

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpAckFrequency -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TCPDelAckTicks -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.name: Apply: Disable Large Send Offload (LSO)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables Large Send Offload v2 (IPv4/IPv6) on all up adapters to reduce packet batching and latency.

steps.command: Get-NetAdapter | Where-Object {$_.Status -eq 'Up'} | ForEach-Object { try { Set-NetAdapterAdvancedProperty -Name $_.Name -DisplayName 'Large Send Offload v2 (IPv4)' -DisplayValue 'Disabled' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {} try { Set-NetAdapterAdvancedProperty -Name $_.Name -DisplayName 'Large Send Offload v2 (IPv6)' -DisplayValue 'Disabled' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {} }

Get-NetAdapter | Where-Object {$_.Status -eq 'Up'} | ForEach-Object { try { Set-NetAdapterAdvancedProperty -Name $_.Name -DisplayName 'Large Send Offload v2 (IPv4)' -DisplayValue 'Enabled' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {} try { Set-NetAdapterAdvancedProperty -Name $_.Name -DisplayName 'Large Send Offload v2 (IPv6)' -DisplayValue 'Enabled' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {} }

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables Large Send Offload v2 (IPv4/IPv6) on all up adapters to reduce packet batching and latency.
items.name: Revert: Disable Large Send Offload (LSO)

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Enables MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts) for detected devices in this class (requires reboot).

args: $devs=Get-PnpDevice -PresentOnly -Class 'Net' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; foreach($d in $devs){$id=$d.InstanceId; $reg='HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\'+$id+'\Device Parameters\Interrupt Management\MessageSignaledInterruptProperties'; New-Item -Path $reg -Force | Out-Null; New-ItemProperty -Path $reg -Name 'MSISupported' -PropertyType DWord -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null }

items.name: Apply: QoS: Prioritize Fortnite (DSCP 46 UDP/TCP)
items.description:
[Focus: Ping / Network, Latency / Input Delay]
Sets a QoS UDP/TCP policy which prioritizes Fortnite's network traffic by tagging packets with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding). This helps your router process the game's packets first, which can stabilize ping and reduce packet loss on congested networks. Notes:
- Policy is created in the ActiveStore and is fully reversible from Falcon Optimizer.
- Works best if your router respects DSCP tags and your ISP does not strip them.
- If you see any weird network behavior, simply toggle this off to remove the policy.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Fortnite DSCP46' -AppPathNameMatchCondition '*FortniteClient-Win64-Shipping.exe' -DSCPAction 46 -PolicyStore ActiveStore -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Fortnite DSCP46' -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.name: Apply: QoS: Prioritize Game Traffic (DSCP 46)
items.description:
[Focus: Ping / network stability, jitter, packet loss]
Creates a Windows QoS policy that tags **Overwatch** packets with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding). If your network gets congested (someone streaming/updates), routers that honor DSCP can schedule game packets first. What to expect:
- Best case: smoother ping under load, fewer spikes.
- Worst case: no change (ISP/router strips DSCP). How to test:
- Turn this on.
- Start a download/stream on the same network.
- Compare in-game ping/jitter with and without. Notes:
- Ethernet usually beats Wi‑Fi for jitter.
- Fully reversible: toggle off removes the policy.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Overwatch DSCP46' -AppPathNameMatchCondition '*Overwatch.exe' -DSCPAction 46 -PolicyStore ActiveStore -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Overwatch DSCP46' -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.name: Apply: QoS: Prioritize Game Traffic (DSCP 46)
items.description:
[Focus: Ping / network stability, jitter, packet loss]
Creates a Windows QoS policy that tags **Valorant** packets with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding). If your network gets congested (someone streaming/updates), routers that honor DSCP can schedule game packets first. What to expect:
- Best case: smoother ping under load, fewer spikes.
- Worst case: no change (ISP/router strips DSCP). How to test:
- Turn this on.
- Start a download/stream on the same network.
- Compare in-game ping/jitter with and without. Notes:
- Ethernet usually beats Wi‑Fi for jitter.
- Fully reversible: toggle off removes the policy.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Valorant DSCP46' -AppPathNameMatchCondition '*VALORANT-Win64-Shipping.exe' -DSCPAction 46 -PolicyStore ActiveStore -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Valorant DSCP46' -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

[Focus: Ping / network stability, jitter, packet loss]
Creates a Windows QoS policy that tags **Call of Duty** packets with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding). If your network gets congested (someone streaming/updates), routers that honor DSCP can schedule game packets first. What to expect:
- Best case: smoother ping under load, fewer spikes.
- Worst case: no change (ISP/router strips DSCP). How to test:
- Turn this on.
- Start a download/stream on the same network.
- Compare in-game ping/jitter with and without. Notes:
- Ethernet usually beats Wi‑Fi for jitter.
- Fully reversible: toggle off removes the policy.
items.name: Revert: QoS: Prioritize Game Traffic (DSCP 46)

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Call of Duty DSCP46' -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.name: Apply: QoS: Prioritize Launcher / Anti‑Cheat Traffic (DSCP 46)
items.description:
[Focus: matchmaking stability]
Adds a second QoS policy for the launcher/anti‑cheat process commonly used with **Call of Duty**. When it helps:
- Party/matchmaking traffic shares a busy connection. If unsure:
- Leave this off and only use the main game policy.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Call of Duty Launcher DSCP46' -AppPathNameMatchCondition '*Battle.net.exe' -DSCPAction 46 -PolicyStore ActiveStore -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Call of Duty Launcher DSCP46' -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

items.name: Apply: Disable Nagle (All Interfaces)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables Nagle algorithm for all interfaces (low latency).

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ New-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpNoDelay -PropertyType DWord -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null }
$ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpNoDelay -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Disables Nagle algorithm for all interfaces (low latency).
items.name: Revert: Disable Nagle (All Interfaces)

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpNoDelay -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.name: Apply: Disable Delayed ACK (All Interfaces)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Reduces ACK delay for lower latency.

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ New-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpAckFrequency -PropertyType DWord -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null; New-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TCPDelAckTicks -PropertyType DWord -Value 0 -Force | Out-Null }

$ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpAckFrequency -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TCPDelAckTicks -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay, Ping / Network] Reduces ACK delay for lower latency.
items.name: Revert: Disable Delayed ACK (All Interfaces)

steps.command: $ifs=Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interfaces'; foreach($i in $ifs){ Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TcpAckFrequency -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Remove-ItemProperty -Path $i.PSPath -Name TCPDelAckTicks -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
